original_title: Sri Lanka local government polls put off after cash squeeze
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will not hold local government polls on March 09, as funds had not been provided, the island’s Elections Commission said in a statement.
“The local government polls scheduled for March 09 will not be held due to circumstances outside of the Elections Commission,” the agency said.
The commission has decided to seek the intervention of the Parliamentary Speaker to get funds released, the statement said.
Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers had directed the Treasury Secretary to prioritize funds for a series of essential services. Elections were not on the list.
Opposition parties in Sri Lanka went to court to get an order to hold the elections while one individual sought an order to invalidate the polls.

Opposition legislators have slammed the government for blocking funds, saying it allowed the finance minister to decide whether or not an election can be held and it set a bad precedent. (Colombo/Feb24/202
